column4: In fact, I was using the Linux box to print to the printer on another machine just fine, but wanted to move my stuff to ubuntu to consolidate it as my server for everything.. seems my plan has backfired

On top of it, one of the Linux help docs for Ubuntu says about using Windows to be the print server "why would you want this  ?"  And that made me even more mad because I say "BECAUSE AT LEAST SHARING A PRINTER ON WINDOWS WORKS!"
it is frustrating however please avoid going into an all caps rage...
for the priter share do you allow all clients? guest access may be needed if your win boxes are not authenticating...
I have it shared for any and all clients
it says "Allow printing for everyone except these users:"  and there is no one in that list
ipp://192.168.2.108:631/printers/Deskjet4135  is the addy of the printer
hp:/usb/Deskjet_F4100_series?serial=CN7BK4S5TQ0542   is the other addy I have
try doing a \\servername on your windows box and see if you can see the printers...
I assume you mean replace servername with the IP of my linux box?
The network path was not found
can you ping the ip of the linux server?
how do I ping the server?  from Windows run or ubuntu?
from winxp machine, Will try the win7 machine now
you  can pm me to avoid flooding the chan
winxp pings and now shows the printer but win7 does not
